questions.question: After WW2 The US and the USSR went from allies to enemies because-

choices.answer: The United Nations kept the Soviet Union out
The Soviet Union wanted control of Japan
They felt the other nation was a threat to their security
They found out the other nation wanted to ally with Germany

questions.question: What major event would begin due to the U.S. dropped the atomic bomb on Japan in WW2?

choices.answer: The Space Race
The Arms Race
The Korean War
The Sino-Soviet Split

questions.question: How did the U.S. keep war-torn Europe from falling to Communism in the 1940s?

choices.answer: They placed armed troops along borders with Russia
The U.S. placed nuclear weapon silos in allied nations
They sent billion of dollars in aid via the Marshall Plan
They used a U.N. peace keeping force inside Western Europe

questions.question: Why is the 1950s considered a time of prosperity in the United States?

choices.answer: Increase in funding of the stock market
The nationalization of important industries
Increased spending, benefits for veterans, improve education
The creation of a national consumer database

questions.question: During the 1950s more people began to migrate from urban areas to-

choices.answer: coastal regions
suburban areas
rural areas
the Sunbelt states

questions.question: Why did demand for houses increase and college attendance rise during the 1950s?

choices.answer: Benefits given to returning veterans from the G.I. Bill
All-time low housing prices due to increased competition
Nationalization of the housing market and education
increased use of technology in U.S. society

questions.question: What is a negative effect of the urban sprawl and interstate highway system?

choices.answer: Increased use of technology in U.S. society
Increase in money used for spending
Deforestation and impact on animal migration and habitats
Reliance on automobiles and cheap housing

questions.question: Which explains why the U.S. changed its motto and the Pledge of Allegiance in 1956?

choices.answer: A recent surge of Christian immigrants influenced government
To join in a new faith-based alliance in Europe
U.S. currency needed updating
to make the U.S. opposite of the atheist Soviet Union

questions.question: Why did the U.S. enter the Space Race against the Soviet Union after 1957?

choices.answer: The creation of new ICBM systems
The launch of the Soviet satellite Sputnik alarmed the U.S.
The creation of the first spaceship
A need to motivate the U.S. to create new engineers

questions.question: How did Joseph McCarthy and McCarthyism begin a Second Red Scare in the 1950s?

choices.answer: He worked to create and amendment restricting immigration
He had police round up suspected communists
He started a panic about Communism spreading in the U.S.
He had thousands deported without warrants

questions.question: What was a major impact of Rock and Roll on U.S. culture in the 1950s?

choices.answer: It created a counterculture, generational divide
It became a source of communist propaganda
never became popular in the United States and had no impact
The first time African-Americans had recognition in music

questions.question: How did the invention of the television change the U.S. starting in the 1950s?

choices.answer: Society became more focused on outdoor activities a
People focused on college education and family roles
Society focused on patriotism and military service
People focused on appearance and service industry jobs

questions.question: What was the purpose of the House Un-American Activities Committee?

choices.answer: To expose suspected Communists and blacklist them
It was a special impeachment hearing of President Truman
To create a new special task force to investigate corruption
To recruit former Nazi scientists for the arms race

questions.question: Why did the Verona Papers make Americans feels McCarthy was right about communist infiltration?

choices.answer: They showed the Soviet Union had control over the President
They exposed Soviet spies and Americans working for them.
They secret detailed U.S.-Soviet relations
They showed the U.S. Communists to take over China

questions.question: What was the major impact of the Space Race on life in the United States?

choices.answer: New technologies improved life (helmets, enriched food)
It created an advanced system of laser sattelites
It allowed the U.S. to move to green energy
Winning made Americans eager to win the Cold War

questions.question: This group of people wrote against 1950's conformity and emphasized individuality.

choices.answer: Beat Generation
McCarthyists
G.I. Bill detractors
College Professors

questions.question: What was the main objective of the Great Society proposed by LBJ?

choices.answer: Comprehensive immigration reform
increased defense spending to build up military
increased grants to universities and private schools
A "War on Poverty" to assist Americans in need of aid

questions.question: 1969: "3 Day of Peace and Music," a rock and roll festival.

choices.answer: Woodstock
Nashville
Graceland
Portland

questions.question: What happened at the Democratic National Headquarters, the Watergate Hotel?

choices.answer: the hotel was targeted by communist spies
it was broken into by five men supposedly working for Nixon
it was the location of the nation's largest mass shooting
it was the sight of the largest protest in history

questions.question: What was discovered when the tapes were released about the Watergate break in?

choices.answer: Nixon was involved in Watergate and lied to the country
Soviet Spies had headquarters there
The President had been a Soviet spy
The Democratic Party had been harboring communists
